title: GDPR Compliance Data Collection System
summary: Architecting the application layer and CI/CD workflows for a regulatory system collecting customer data to meet EU GDPR requirements.
content:
PROBLEM:
The bank required a centralized system to collect customer data from various systems to fulfill EU GDPR requirements (Right of Access). The challenge involved integrating disparate banking systems, ensuring high observability, and enabling a team of developers new to the Java/Spring ecosystem to deliver production-ready code.

SOLUTION:
Focusing on the application lifecycle and resources on existing ING private cloud infrastructure, I:
- Configured OpenShift namespaces and resource quotas for the project.
- Designed and implemented robust CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps for automated delivery.
- Developed a comprehensive Java/Spring Boot application skeleton that served as a standardized blueprint for the team.
- Configured full observability (monitoring, logging, alerting) using Prometheus and Grafana.
- Onboarded and mentored 3 developers, guiding them from zero to proficiency in Spring Boot.

ARCHITECTURE:
The system functioned as an event-driven consumer listening to Kafka topics. Upon receiving a trigger, it orchestrated data retrieval from multiple banking systems, generated a comprehensive PDF report, and securely uploaded it to a file repository accessible via mobile and web channels for the end customer.

RESULT:
- Successfully met strict regulatory deadlines.
- The mentored team delivered a stable, high-quality application independently.
- The automated pipeline and observability setup reduced operational overhead to a minimum.
